weather_report:
As midnight gives way to dawn, Downtown San Francisco wears a calm, clear blanket of tranquility. The air is crisp, laced with a gentle north-northeast breeze that carries whispers of the sea and the promise of a sun-kissed day. With temperatures expected to hover in the mild mid-sixties, the chill of the night will soon yield to the warmth of the sun, though a cool edge may linger in the afternoon. 

The forecast heralds a radiant Tuesday, bringing bright sunshine and pristine visibility. There’s no sign of fog—an unusual treat for this time of year—which leaves the Golden Gate Bridge and the cityscape free of the usual shroud, inviting adventurers to explore. The clarity of the day suggests it is perfect for a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or perhaps a visit to one of the cozy coffee shops dotting the Mission District, where one can savor a warm drink while basking in the golden glow of the morning light. A light jacket will suffice for the early hours, transitioning to a comfortable shirt as the sun's rays begin to embrace the city. Take advantage of this serene weather—perhaps a casual bike ride across the Golden Gate or a moment spent in peace at a waterfront park. Today promises a unique beauty, where the city feels both alive and refreshingly tranquil.
